description: From the relatively remote rural area of Mangrove Mountain, this walk makes a loop through the historic roads and settlements

markers.description: Plan your drive to Mangrove Mountain.
From the carpark near the gate down Dubbo Gully Road, continue on foot.
From the gate follow Dubbo Gully Road into the valley.
Cross the bridge across the creek and continue past the fields.
The cemetery along the track is a historical remnant of early settlement.
Continue left at the intersection to follow the loop clockwise.
An abandoned homestead overlooks the overgrown fields.
From the intersection cross the fields to the right to follow Simpsons track up the gully.
Simpsons Track ends at a campground with toilet facilities.
From the campground follow the Old Great North Road to the right, following the signs to Clare's Bridge.
+1.5h/6km Extend the walk with the loop trail around Wat Buddha Dhamma, by following the Old Great North Road to the left instead.
At the intersection follow the Wat Loop Trail to the right.
The Wat loop trail eventually joins back up with the Old Great North Road at a gate, follow it to the left.
Cross the historical bridge and continue down the Old Great North Road.
Pass the gate and follow the trail down around historical Clare's Bridge.
At the intersection of many trails, follow the fork right down Donny's Trail and not the wider fire trail directly to the right.
Where the trail starts to zig zag down the ridge, several unfenced lookouts offer wide views across the valley.
The remnants of historic roadworks are evident along the track.
Pass the gate and finish the descent into the gully.
At the intersection follow Ten Mile Hollow Road to the left and retract your route back to the carpark.
Plan your drive back from Mangrove Mountain.
